page.title: 13HOUSES IN HAYFIELD
page.content: In our square of six km,there are a lot of farms,most of them dated about 1820. Most of the farms are situated on moorland because the majority of farmers breed sheep, and the sheep thrive well on moorland.Most of the houses are built in the actual village of Hayfield or in the village of Little Hayfield.There are three public houses in the area.One is in Birch Vale,one in Hayfield and one in Little Hayfield.Most of the public houses are built in the community because if they were built in isolated areas no one would go there.There are a lot of terraced houses in the area because a lot of mill owners built them,terraced house being cheapest to build and they were mainly built in the late 19th century.The oldest houses are terraced houses but the new ones are detached or semi-detached.
